etymology.description: semantic: 羊(羊) (yáng, 'sheep') + phonetic: 羊(羊) (yáng, 'sheep') repeated thrice = associated with sheep or mutton
etymology.interpretation: The character 羴(羴) (shān) emphasizes its meaning through the repetition of 羊(羊) (yáng, 'sheep'), intensifying the idea of sheep, typically used to represent a strong sheep-related odor or taste.

examples.chinese: 这块羊肉带有羴香(這塊羊肉帶有羴香)。
examples.pinyin: Zhè kuài yángròu dài yǒu shān xiāng.
examples.english: This piece of lamb meat has a mutton-like aroma.

examples.chinese: 山上的羊(山上的羊)，散发着淡淡的羴味(散發著淡淡的羴味)。
examples.pinyin: Shān shàng de yáng, sàn fā zhe dàn dàn de shān wèi.
examples.english: The mountain sheep exude a subtle mutton smell.

examples.chinese: 这羊虽然羴味浓烈(這羊雖然羴味濃烈)，但肉质鲜美(但肉質鮮美)。
examples.pinyin: Zhè yáng suīrán shān wèi nóng liè, dàn ròu zhì xiān měi.
examples.english: Although this sheep has a strong mutton odor, its meat is delicious.
